Chicago is heading for a shutdown because alders in the Corporate Caucus won’t commit to taxing ultra-wealthy corporationseven after years of rising costs for working families.

Mayor Johnson is clear: “We will not sacrifice the poor and working people of Chicago to balance this budget.”

Alders have a choice: tax ultra-wealthy corporations, or shut down services for the people who keep this city running.

Our schools, our safety, and the workers who make this city run are not bargaining chips.

Tell your alder:keep Chicago open. Tax the rich.
